timeline.bodyText: Should you leave the members public since the class is internal? Less to update later to make it public again.
timeline.author: schaabs

replies.bodyText:
This will be a checkstyle  (code style rule) violation  and will fail the CI, if I do that.
Will need to suppress this rule for this class to leave it as public.
I can make a //TODO note here to enable in future., that will be less work.
replies.author: g2vinay

replies.bodyText: An alternative is moving the class to implementation package which you are doing for AuthenticationRecord class?
replies.author: jianghaolu

timeline.bodyText: why moving this to implementation instead of changing the modifier to be package-private?
timeline.author: jianghaolu

replies.bodyText: to ensure, the classes  in implementation package such asMsalAuthenticationAccount and IdentityClientOptions can access this class and the underlying implementation retains as it is.
replies.author: g2vinay

timeline.bodyText: Could use @schaabs 's opinion but should this be kept for SharedTokenCacheCredential? Since enablePersistentCache is effectively always true.
timeline.author: jianghaolu

replies.bodyText: We discussed offline and have decided to remove the configuration and make the default True for this release. Since the SharedTokenCacheCredential will not create the cache if it doesn't exist. It will only ever support using the unencrypted cache if the encrypted is not available and the unencrypted already exists.
replies.author: schaabs

replies.bodyText: enabled this by default in build method.
replies.author: g2vinay
